subject: Assumptions and expected exception
msgSnippet: Hi there, I have a test method along the lines of: @Test(expected = IOException.class) public void testErrorResult() throws Exception {
messageBody:
Hi there,

I have a test method along the lines of:

@Test(expected = IOException.class)
public void testErrorResult() throws Exception
{
assumeTrue(someCondition());
codeThatShouldThrowIOException();
}

When someCondition() is true, the test method behaves correctly -- it passes if codeThatShouldThrowIOException() throws the exception and fails if the exception is not thrown.

However, if someCondition() is false, I'd expect the test to pass no matter whether we expect exceptions or not. With JUnit 4.6 this doesn't seem to hold -- the test with unmet assumption fails, probably because it expects an exception that the code doesn't even have a chance to throw. Is this the intended behaviour? If so, is there any way to use @Test(expect = ...) with assumptions?

Thanks,

Staszek
